DataElement.preferredName: PROMIS Version 2.0 Pediatric Fatigue 4210R2r Past Week Hard to Pay Attention Because of Tiredness Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation, in the past 7 days, how often they were so tired it was hard for them to pay attention, using a 5-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PROMIS Pediatric and Parent Proxy Physical Health Domain Fatigue Subordinate Domain Past Week Hard to Pay Attention Because of Tiredness Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The set of PROMIS measures that assess the physical health of pediatric subjects through self-report or parent proxy report._The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess fatigue that is likely to decrease an individual's ability to carry out daily activities, including the ability to work effectively and to function at their usual level in family or social roles._The most recent week, including today._A question about whether an individual has or had trouble paying attention because they are tired._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: PROMIS Pediatric and Parent Proxy Physical Health Domain Fatigue Subordinate Domain
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The set of PROMIS measures that assess the physical health of pediatric subjects through self-report or parent proxy report.:The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess fatigue that is likely to decrease an individual's ability to carry out daily activities, including the ability to work effectively and to function at their usual level in family or social roles.

Concepts.longName: PROMIS Pediatric and Parent Proxy Physical Health Domain
Concepts.definition: The set of PROMIS measures that assess the physical health of pediatric subjects through self-report or parent proxy report.

The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess fatigue that is likely to decrease an individual's ability to carry out daily activities, including the ability to work effectively and to function at their usual level in family or social roles.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Hard to Pay Attention Because of Tiredness Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A question about whether an individual has or had trouble paying attention because they are tired.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: Hard to Pay Attention Because of Tiredness
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual has or had trouble paying attention because they are tired.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PROMIS:Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System, PROMIS Health Organization and PROMIS Cooperative Group, 2008-2012

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used with the PROMIS items that describes a range of subjective scores from 1 (Never) to 5 (Always).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something rarely happens.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer that something rarely happens.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

Concepts.definition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: On many occasions, or in many situations.

Concepts.definition: On many occasions, or in many situations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened almost all of the time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened almost all of the time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: PROMIS Item Banks (Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System)

ClassificationSchemeItems.longName: Pediatric and Parent Proxy Physical Health

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
